Title: Cscope: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
Synopsis:
Multiple vulnerabilities in Cscope might allow for the remote execution of
    arbitrary code.

Background.Text: Cscope is a developer's tool for browsing source code.

Description.Text: James Peach of Apple discovered a stack-based buffer overflow in cscope's handling of long file system paths (CVE-2009-0148). Multiple stack-based buffer overflows were reported in the putstring function when processing an overly long function name or symbol in a source code file (CVE-2009-1577).

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted source file, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All Cscope users should upgrade to the latest version:
